Description: Textile fragment; large, medium-quality linen cloth. Undyded, but now greyish-beige in colour (i.e. modern dirt). Very worn, but no darning. The weave is plain [warp-faced simple tabby] and the threads are S-spun and S-spliced; the stitch gauge is warp c.19 ends per 10mm and weft c.12 picks per 10mm. Edges are torn or ragged.
Curator's comments: Has an aromatic smell like Roman Period cloths, but it may have just caught it from another textile. Date is unknown, but it has an early-ish feel. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor [1992]
